definitions.text: a state of arrangement or appearance
a decoration or adornment on a garment
attitude of an aircraft in flight when allowed to take its own orientation
cutting down to the desired size or shape
remove the edges from and cut down to the desired size
cut down on; make a reduction in
examples: The employer wants to cut back health benefits

definitions.text: balance in flight by regulating the control surfaces
be in equilibrium during a flight
decorate (food), as with parsley or other ornamental foods
cultivate, tend, and cut back the growth of
examples: dress the plants in the garden

definitions.text: adjust (sails on a ship) so that the wind is optimally used

examples: the spare figure of a marathon runner
a body kept trim by exercise

definitions.text: of places; characterized by order and neatness; free from disorder

examples: a clean-cut and well-bred young man
the trig corporal in his jaunty cap

definitions.text: severely simple in line or design
